alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Monmouth and southern Middlesex Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jamesburg, or 9 miles south of New Brunswick, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Perth Amboy, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, Marlboro, Manalapan, Matawan, Jamesburg, Cranbury, Brownville, East Freehold, Dayton, Robertsville, Clearbrook Park, Yorketown, Whittingham, Morganville, Kendall Park and Twin Rivers. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 9. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 121 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
